Classic sequel to a classic game.

Pros:
100% Amazing.
Amazing and fun co-op.
Endless content with level creator.
Awesome story mode.
Controller support.
Best game I have ever played.

Cons:
15GB Needed to download,
Micro-Transactions
Limited assets in level creator
All co-op teams have a random operator who can end the game and cheat.
Delayed audio.

Great puzzle game with a very interesting storyline. This game is fun to play if you're alone and want to experience an adventure type of game. You can also co-op with friends but from my understanding you need LAN to do so. I would recommend this to anyone since it's just a really fun experience overall.

Cool puzzle game,can't say much considering i couldn't bother to play through all of it,but it's fun,cool gameplay,and the story is interesting
But c'mon,it's PORTAL,this game is a classic,everyone knows portal,and if you don't,you at least heard of the portal gun

Great puzzle game. I really like how they tried to create something different. The atmosphere is great and the story line helps pull the puzzles along.

In my opinion it's one of the best games ever made - with more than over 120.000 coop maps and over 600.000 singleplayer maps from the workshop by now, the game never get boring. Also don't forget about the funny story mode. Such an Evergreen. Hopefully there will be a 3rd part of the game!!! Very recommended and worth it!

Meiner Meinung eines der besten Spiele, das jemals kreiert wurde. Mit den mehr als 120.000 Coop und Ã¼ber 600.000 Singleplayer Maps aus dem Workshop wird das niemals langweilig. Der lustige Story Modus ist ebenfalls nicht zu vergessen. Es ist und bleibt ein Evergreen. Hoffentlich bekommen wir noch in diesem Leben einen 3. Teil von dem Spiel! Sehr zu empfehlen, es lohnt sich!

where do i begin with this game? this game has an amazing story, amazing character and most importantly, the co-op mode! i played it with a friend (which was fun) but there is a problem, taunting can be impossible because if you have a controller plugged in, its hard to taunt. anyways this game is still very fun even though it has its glitches. portal 3 might take awhile.

Ive played this game for about 5 times, and i gotta say this game is still really fun. First off, this game in my mind has a really good intro that helps you link up to the old game, at first it doesn't, but once you really start playing the game, you'll start noticing old places, this in my mind is how you start off a sequel. Later on in the game you'll discover more things about Aperture, thus making an even better world of the Portal AND Half Life universe. On a technical term, the level design and puzzles are easy but well made, and soon get more complex and harder.  That isn't all, you also have CO-OP mode, and you can make your own puzzles to. The CO-OP mode is really good, as you actually have  to work as a team to finish puzzles, if you've played through these puzzles you'll know that the team at VALVe really likes to get creative, which makes this Gaming company and Hardware company, the more better. While this  may be all the game offers, The Dialogue, Voice Acting, Atmosphere, Tone, Official Soundtrack, Game play and more are very well made and hand crafted, thank you VALVe for making if not a 2nd better sequel!

This is my favorite Valve game ever. This game is fantastic, I wouldn't change a thing about it. The characters are so funny, the lines are so quotable. I could play this game over and over again, no joke, I could watch the credits roll and play it again. I LOVE Portal 2. If you haven't played it please do, you haven't lived until you have. Is it too much to ask for a Portal 3 I mean come on Valve...
Like the first Portal game, it great! Sometimes I found the story line confusing though. But, overall it a fantastic game!
The best puzzle game I've ever played.

i only played the coop but i had a blast super fun and increases your IQ significantly
This game is one of the best one's I'e played. it's funny, has a great main idea, has very well thought out puzzles. Just play the darn game man.

One of my all-time favorite games.

Single player:
It's very fun and just.. portal. I enjoy puzzle games in general, but the use of portals adds an entirely new depth to it. It really does make you think differently, hence "Thinking with portals". As the second game in this franchise, it really experiments with new ideas. With the addition of the excursion funnels, light bridges, the different gel types, etc, it adds all these brilliant things into game that I already loved. On top of the great mechanics and challenging puzzles that build the base for this game, there's just enough humor and story elements sprinkled in to make it a really unique experience.

Co-op:
The co-op is on an entirely different level. Now instead of 2 portals, you have to think with 4? And work together, resisting the urge to send your partner-in-science shooting into the pits below? Now that's a challenge. On a serious note, the co-op does require a lot of teamwork and thinking outside the box. Doing puzzles with 2 people, 2 portals each is much different than doing puzzles alone. The co-op built into the game is fantastic as is, but the community maps are something I can appreciate after originally playing this game on console. From the unique puzzle maps, to the gel racing maps, it reinstalled my love for this game with new content.

Ratings:
Gameplay       9
Enjoyment    10
Multiplayer     9
Replayability  5
Overall        9.5

Highly recommend

Si jugaste el primer portal y te gustÃ³ lo que viste, preparate porque esta secuela deja a su antecesor como una demo de 3 horas. Toma el concepto tan original de puzzles con portales y lo expande en todos los sentidos, tanto en el gameplay, en su historia, en su apartado grÃ¡fico; en fin lo profundiza. Se nota como el equipo de desarrollo de Valve le pone su toque en muchos puntos del juego. 
Si tuviese que dar las razones de porque debes comprarlo y jugarlo, puedo resumirlo en que el juego estÃ¡ estructurado en una forma de afrontar la trama que me recordÃ³ mucho a los half-life, con detalles en todo momento. Desde el lado jugable, sigue utilizando portales de entrada y de salida, pero mientras avanza el juego aÃ±ade distintos tipos de implementos que juegan con la fÃ­sica del entorno para resolver los puzzles (fluidos de hipervelocidad, de repulsiÃ³n, campos gravitacionales, etc). 
Por fuera del modo historia, existe el apartado de mapas hechos por la comunidad que son una locura, la oportunidad de jugar en co-op tanto la historia como el modo comunidad, modos de desafÃ­o, y niveles agregados como citas de audios con conceptos del equipo de desarrollo mientras estaban organizando el juego.
Es un juego que me dejÃ³ una gran sensaciÃ³n al terminarlo, al igual que el primero. Es corto pero vale mucho la pena, muy recomendado!
